works.complaint:
Within the google review policies it is quite  
descriptive of what is appropriate and what is not.

-Off-topic reviews: Reviews should describe your personal, first-hand  
experience with a specific place. Don’t post reviews based on someone  
else’s experience, or that are not about the specific place you are  
reviewing. Reviews are not a forum for personal rants or crusades. Don’t  
use reviews to report incorrect information about a place--use the Report a  
problem link for that place instead.

The majority of low reviews are opinions formulated from a photo series  
mocking human advertising which was sensationalized by the media. These are  
personal opinions not reviews on services or encounters within the  
business. Which in turn is abusive toward the staff members of this salon.  
After receiving many death threats from individuals who did not understand  
the facts behind these photos. It adds insult to injury to be plagued with  
horrible reviews from people who have never been to the salon or received a  
service from the salon. They violate googles policy. These reviews should  
be removed.
